#summary Eclipse Plugins that Help

= Introduction =

There are a few plugins/settings for Eclipse that are necessary before diving in with the mavenized GWT project we just generated.


= Details =

== Prepare Eclipse ==

  * Assumption: WTP already set up with a Server
  * [http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/installing-m2eclipse.html m2Eclipse Core] from the [http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/sites/m2e core update site] for Maven Integration
  * [http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/installing-m2eclipse.html m2Eclipse Extras] from the [http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/sites/m2e-extras extras update site] for Maven WTP Integration
  * [http://code.google.com/eclipse/docs/download.html Google Plugin for Eclipse] from the [http://dl.google.com/eclipse/plugin/3.7 update site] for the Google-provided functionality and SDKs.  (Leave out the GWT Designer for now, so we can install the full-fledged version next.)
  * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/tools/download-gwtdesigner.html GWT Designer] from [http://dl.google.com/eclipse/inst/d2gwt/latest/3.7 its update site] to get the complete build of the designer.
  * Update Eclipse configuration to execute {{{process-resources}}} maven goal on import:<br><img src="http://pittjug-gwt-201108.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/eclipse-import-process-resources.png">

== Import the Project ==

  * Import... Maven > Existing Maven Projects:<br><img src="http://pittjug-gwt-201108.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/eclipse-import-existing-maven-project.png"><br><img src="http://pittjug-gwt-201108.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/eclipse-import-pom.png">
  * Google provides [http://code.google.com/intl/en/eclipse/docs/faq.html FAQ] entries on using [http://code.google.com/intl/en/eclipse/docs/faq.html#gwt_in_eclipse_for_java_ee WTP] and on using [http://code.google.com/intl/en/eclipse/docs/faq.html#gwt_with_maven Maven] with GWT projects.
  * Add the Dynamic Web Project you just imported to your Server.  Server should launch successfully at this point.
  * In the project's build path, remove the "**" exclusion for the main and test resources folders.  This later allows the modules to be detected automatically.
  * In the project's context menu, select Google > Web Toolkit Settings... and check "Use Google Web Toolkit".  Then, ensure the entry point modules are detected:<br><img src="http://pittjug-gwt-201108.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/eclipse-use-google-web-toolkit.png">
